dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Joey, would you slow down? They're not gonna be sold out of papers at one o'clock in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm excited! I've never gotten reviewed before.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: You were so amazing as the king. I was really impressed, I was.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Although, you know what? You might want to consider wearing underwear next time. Yeah, cause when you sat down on your throne you could kind of see your... royal subject.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Here it is, here it is. [reading from newspaper] The only thing worse than the mindless, adolescent direction was Joseph Tribbiani's disturbingly unskilled portrayal of the king.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: OK, look, that is one guy's opinion, alright. Phoebs, read yours.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: OK. [reading] The only thing worse than the mindless, adolescent direction...

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Does anyone have one from a different paper? Ross, read yours.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't want to.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Joey, honey, they don't know what they're talking about.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe they do. I've been doin' this ten years and I haven't gotten anywhere. There's gotta be a reason.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh c'mon. Maybe you're just, uhhh... paying your dues.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, it.. it's too hard. It's not worth it. I quit.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait one minute. Wait a minute. I believe this will change your mind. [Reads from paper] In a mediocre play, Joseph Tribbiana was able to achieve brilliant new levels of... continued on page 153...[turns it] sucking.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica comforting Joey at Monica and Rachel's
apartment.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: When I was little, I wanted to be a veteranarian, but then I found out you had to put your hands into cows and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [sullenly] Hiiiiii.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Are... are you OK?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, just a tough day at work. A stegosaurus fell over and trapped a kid. Whoa, whoa, I know this jacket, this is, th--Fun Bobby's jacket! Where is he, what. He, he's here, isn't he?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Maybe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Don't toy with me.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Geller!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Fun Bobby!

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Hey. Whoa, hey, you've been working out, huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not at all! I love this guy. Hey, I was so psyched to hear you're back with my sister!

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: You and me both.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Hey, so what'd I miss, what'd I miss, c'mon?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, we were just trying to make Joey feel better.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Hey, do you need me to pick you up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I'm alright man. Really.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: No, I'm picking you up.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey no, seriously, I don't need you to pick me... [Fun Bobby picks Joey up off the ground, bounces him. Joey laughs.] Alright! It still works.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: OK, now before I go, does anybody else need to be picked up? [everyone raises their hands] I'm still gonna go.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: OK, I'll see you later babe.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Uh, public display of affection coming up. You can avert your eyes. [kisses Monica]

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: See ya. [exits]

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Bye! See you later!

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Fun Bobby is so great.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh, isn't he? Oh, you know, I really think this time it may work with him. I mean, he just makes me feel so good and I've been feeling so lousy this last couple of months, no job, no boyfriend. Well, at least my cup is half full.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Half full of looooovvvvve .

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: And for our two-week anniversary, he's gonna take me to his cousin's cabin for the weekend.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Cabin of loooooovvvvve .

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: We went through a lot of wine tonight, you guys. [walks over to table, holding five empty wine bottles]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Really? I only had two glasses.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I just had a glass.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Two.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: I had one glass.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: I had about a mugful in this lovely 'I got boned at the Museum of Natural History' mug.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: OK, so that's... that's what, two bottles? And yet somehow we went through five?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oooooh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [realizing what everyone else did a minute ago] Ooooooh.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: So what. So he drank a lot tonight.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah but, you know, now that I think about it, I don't think I've ever seen Fun Bobby without a... a drink in his hand.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Oh, OOOH, yeah, you know, did you notice how he always starts his stories with, um, OK, 'I was soooo wasted,' or, 'Oh, we were soooo bombed,' or, ummm, ooh, ooh, 'So I wake up, and I'm in this dumpster in Connecticut.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Monica, have you ever been with him when he wasn't drinking?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Well, we just happen to go to alot of places where you might drink. I mean, how do you go to a wine tasting without having a drink? Or... or to a club, or to the... zoo.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica comforting Joey at Monica and Rachel's
apartment.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica, Fun Bobby, and Phoebe sitting in Central Perk Rachel is serving
them. She brings a mug to Monica.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Rach, does this have nonfat milk?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ehhhummmm, I don't know, why don't you taste it.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [takes a sip] Mmmm, no.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh well, too late, sorry, you already had some.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: [pulls out a flask] Whattaya say we make these, uh, coffees Irish?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Um, cake.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Yeah, we're gonna... we're gonna get some cake. [Phoebe and Rachel go to counter.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: You know what? It seems like you've been making an awful lot of stuff Irish lately.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Well, I would make them Belgian, but the waffles are hard to get into that flask.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Bobby.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Yeah, OK.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Look, maybe this is none of my business, or maybe it is, I don't know... but, uh, I'm kind of worried about you.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: OK, look, this isn't the first time somebody's said something to me about this, but, I don't know... I always made excuses about it, like... uhhh... 'I'm just a social drinker,' or, 'C'mon, it's Flag Day.'

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: So, what are you saying now?

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: I guess I'm saying, I'll try and quit. I kinda like that you worry about me. [they hug]

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: [comes back to couch, with cake] Sooo, what's goin' on, huh?

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: I am gonna try and quit drinking.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: [sad] Ooohh, why?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Guess who's back in show business.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ohh, ohh, Lorne Green?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: No, no, Phoebs. You know why? Cause he's dead.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, no.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: OK, I guess this is gonna seem kinda bittersweet now, but... Joey, that's who.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, my agent just called me with an audition for Days of Our Lives !

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, well, we have to celebrate. You know what we should do? We should do, like, a soap opera theme.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey, yeah... we could all sleep together and then one of us could get amnesia.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hey Rach, what time do you get off? We're all gonna do something tonight.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ummmm.... well, actually I'm already done, but I...I kinda got plans.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [gasps] You have other friends?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Yeah... I, uhh... I have a... I have a date.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: With a man?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What? What is so strange about me having a date?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What about Ross? I mean, are you still mad at him cause he made that list about you?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Noooo, no, I'm not mad at him. I'm.. I'm not really anything at him anymore.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: I don't know. Whatever I was feeling, I'm... not.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: But you guys came so close.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, I know, I'm sorry you guys. You're just gonna have to get used to the fact that I will not be dating Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Here he is. Hi. Guys, this is Russ.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: [sounding like Ross] Hhhhiiiii.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica, Fun Bobby, and Phoebe sitting in Central Perk Rachel is serving
them. She brings a mug to Monica.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency . Estelle (ESTL) is speaking on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Stop saying you're not talented, you're very talented. It's just with the bird dead and all, there's very little act left. Oh, honey, give me a break, will ya? [a knock on the door] Oooh, ooh, I'll talk to you later.

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Well, there's my favorite client. So tell me darling, how was the audition?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I think it went pretty well. I.. I got a callback for Thursday.

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Joey, have you ever seen me ecstatic?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Well, here it is. [She almost smiles.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: OK, uh.... listen, there's something I want to talk to you about. The network casting lady...

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Oh, isn't Lori a doll?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, yeah, she's great, but... I kinda got the feeling that she was sort of... coming on to me. And I definitely would get the part if I would've... you know... if I would have sent the Little General in.

dialogue.speaker: ESTL
dialogue.text: Oh, I see. Well, I'm just gonna put in a call here and we'll find out what's goin' on and straighten it out. [picks up the phone] Yeah, hi, Lori please. [pause] Hi darling. So how 'bout Joey Tribbiani for the part of the cab driver, isn't he terrific? [pause] Uh-huuuuh. [pause] Uh-huuuuh. OK, doll. Talk to you later. [hangs up] [to Joey] Yeah, you're gonna have to sleep with her.

scenes.location: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency . Estelle (ESTL) is speaking on the phone.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency . Estelle (ESTL) is speaking on the phone.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Monica and Rachel at counter, Phoebe, Chandler, and Fun
Bobby at the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: It's Fun Bobby.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What, isn't he sober?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh, he's sober alright. Just turns out that Fun Bobby was fun for a reason.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ohhh, OK.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Alright, here you go, sweetie. [hands Fun Bobby his coffee]

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Thanks. You wanna hear something funny?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh God, yes!

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: There are no hardware stores open past midnight in the Village.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: That is funny.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: I needed to buy a hammer the other night, and I'm out walkin' around the neighborhood but apparently there are no hardware stores open past midnight in the Village.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Ahhh, hey honey? Don't you have to be at your interview now?

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Oh yeah. See you guys. [leaves]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Bye..... ridiculously dull Bobby.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh.... my... God.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: It's not that bad.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Not that bad? Did you hear the hammer story?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: OK, OK, don't get all squinky.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Maybe it was just the kind of story where you have to be there.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: But I'm gonna be there... for the rest of my life. I mean, I can't break up with him. I'm the one who made him quit drinking. He's dull because of me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Alright, don't say that. He's probably always been dull. You just, you know, set it free.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [turning around] Hey Ross.... bahhhh!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Hi Russ, I've just got two more tables to clean and then we'll go, OK?

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: OK, I'll just sit here and... uh... chat with your, uh.... friend-type....people.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Rachel? Um, hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: OK, so, you know what you're doing, right?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Uhh.... waitressing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Well, yeah, but... no. I mean, umm... doesn't.... doesn't Russ just remind you of someone?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [looks at him] Huh, Bob Saget?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: [looks at Russ] Oh, yeah! No, no, no, no, oh, oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, my, oh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: She's just upset because she, uh, she buttered a spider into her toast this morning.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [to Phoebe] Listen, Phoebs, this is gonna be OK. [introducing Russ and Ross] Ross, Russ. Russ, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Are you a, uh, friend of Rachel's?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I am. Are you a, uh, a friend of Rachel's?

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Actually, I'm a... kind of a.... you know, a... date-type... thing... of Rachel's.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: A date.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm her date.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, you're... uh... you're, oh you're the date.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: You know, this is actually good, because if we ever lose Ross, we have a spare.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you are the, uh... paleontologist.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I am. And you are a....

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Periodontist.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: See? They're as different as night and... later that night.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I am going to, uh... get a beverage. It was nice, nice... uh... meeting you.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Ditto.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I, uh, well... I... I met Russ.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, I didn't know we were, uh, seeing other people.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well, we're not seeing each other, so....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, uh, for your information, there's a woman at the museum, who's curator of moths and other... uh... winged things... who's, uh, let it be known that she is drawn to me much like a... well, you know. But so far I've been keeping her at bay, but, uh, if this is the deal...

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well, yeah, this is the deal.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, well, um, have a nice evening.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Um, Russ, you ready?

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [upset] She's dating. She's dating.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, but did you see who she was dating?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Do you not see it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: See what? I don't know what she sees in... innn that goober. And it takes him, what? Like... like... I don't know, uhh... uhhh, hello.... a... week, to get out a sentence.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's annoying, isn't it?

scenes.location: Central Perk . Monica and Rachel at counter
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Monica and Rachel at counter, Phoebe, Chandler, and Fun
Bobby at the couch.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey is making marinara sauce and filling every
container in sight. Chandler enters.]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, so I'm guessing you didn't get the part, or... uh, Italy called and said it was hungry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, the part's mine if I want it.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, if I'm willing to sleep with the casting lady.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [not knowing how to react] Oh my... God?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ten years I've been waiting for a break like this Chandler, ten years! I mean, Days of Our Lives . That's actually on television.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: So, what're you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I guess I could sleep with her... I mean, how could I do that?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Well, I... I've got a pop-up book that told me everything I need to know.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I've never slept with someone for a part.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Well is she... [reaches into the cookie jar for a cookie, takes his hand out, covered with pasta sauce]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: It's alright. Is she good-looking?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, she's totally good looking. I mean, if I met her in a bar, or something, I'd be buying her breakfast. [pause] You know, after having slept with her.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Y'know, maybe this isn't such a big deal. Y'know, I mean, the way that I see it is you get a great job and you get to have sex. Y'know, I mean, throw in a tree and a fat guy and you've got Christmas.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I just... I just don't think that I want it that way though, y'know? I mean, let's say I do make it, alright? I'm always gonna look back and wonder if it was because of my talent or because of.. y'know, the Little General.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Didn't you used to call it the Little Major?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, but after Denise DeMarco, I had to promote it.

scenes.location:
Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey is making marinara sauce and filling every
container in sight. Chandler enters.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey is making marinara sauce and filling every
container in sight. Chandler enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A restaurant. Fun Bobby and Monica are ordering.]

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Can I get you something from the bar?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Yes, I would like something. [looks at Fun Bobby, changes her mind] No, no thank you.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: If... if you want to drink, it's OK with me, I've got to get used to it.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: No, no really. I.. I wouldn't feel right about it. [to waiter] Just some water.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: So the light went out in my refrigerator...

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [grabs waiter as he's leaving] I'd like a scotch on the rocks with a twist.

scenes.location: A restaurant. Fun Bobby and Monica are ordering.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: A restaurant. Fun Bobby and Monica are ordering.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Chandler is sitting on the couch between Russ and Ross,
doing a crossword puzzle.]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey, we're having some fun now, huh, Ross? Wanna do another one, huh Russ? OK... eleven letters, atomic element number 101... ends in ium .

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Dysprosium.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [condescendingly] Dysprosium? Try mendelevium.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: And weenie number two has it. Unless, of course, nine-down, Knights in White Satin was sung by the Doody Blues.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: You don't see it? You actually don't see it?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: OK honey, you're dating Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: No, Phoebs. I'm dating Russ .

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Russ is Ross. Russ... Ross!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Steve... sleeve!

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: OK, noone is named Sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what the hell are you talking about? Other than their names being similar, I'm sorry, I do not see what you're seeing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [to Russ] For your information, it's a card sharp, not a card shark.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: You could not be more wrong. You could try... but you would not be successful.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: OK, I'm gonna get some more coffee before the pinching and eye-poking begins.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: I know what your problem is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh you do, do you?

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Um-hum, you're jealous.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Of... of what?

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: You're jealous because I'm a real doctor.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, you're a doctor of gums . That's the smallest body part you can major in. It's like day one, floss. Day two, here's your diploma.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Hey, you listen.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, let me finish.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: No, let me finish.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, you let me fini...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ewww, ewww, ewww, ewww! [turns away]

scenes.location: Central Perk . Chandler is sitting on the couch between Russ and Ross
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Chandler is sitting on the couch between Russ and Ross,
doing a crossword puzzle.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Chandler at Monica and Rachel's apartment.]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Did Joey say what he was gonna go when he left?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: No, I don't even think he knew. Hey, would you sleep with somebody to get a great job?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: I don't know. Who would I have to sleep with?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Me.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Why would I have to sleep with you?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: It's my game. You want the job or not?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Morning.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Where ya goin'?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Bobby and I are going away for the weekend, remember?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ooooohhhh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: What's with all the bottles of liquor?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's going on, is... uh, Bobby drinking again?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh no no, this is not for him, this is for me. That way he's still sober but I find his stories about shoelaces much more amusing.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh God, even his knock is boring.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Hi. I'll be ready in just a second.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Uh, can I talk to you a minute?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: This is really hard for me to say.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh God, you fell off the wagon.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, it's about you.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What about me?

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: I think you may have a drinking problem.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What these? [holding up liquor bottles] Oh, these are, um, for.. cuts and scrapes.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Look, I am just not strong enough to be in a codependent relationship right now, OK?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh... shoot.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: Well, anyway, I hope we can be friends.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: OK.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Take care.

dialogue.speaker: FBOB
dialogue.text: You too.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What happened?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Well we... we kinda broke up.

dialogue.speaker: GANG
dialogue.text: Awwwwwwww.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [holding bottles] Does anybody want these?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: I'll take one. Sometimes I like to hold stuff like this and pretend I'm a giant.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: GANG
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How'd the callback go?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It was unbelievable! I walked in there and she was all over me.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: So what'd you do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I couldn't do it. I told her I didn't want to get the part that way.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good for you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But wait, wait, wait. Then, after I left her office, she caught up with me at the elevator and offered me an even bigger part.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: So... and?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Soooooo... you are now looking at Dr. Drake Ramore, neurosurgeon, recurring in at least four episodes!

dialogue.speaker: GANG
dialogue.text: Allright!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright... I've got to go shower. [leaves]

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Central Perk . Russ enters. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting on the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Oh, hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: I guess you guys heard, Rachel dumped me.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm sorry man.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Oh, all she said was that I remind her too much of somebody. You have any idea who she's talking about?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh I do, it's.... it's Bob Saget. She hates him.

dialogue.speaker: RUSS
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hey, Julie! Hey, how are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Um, oh, I don't know. I mean, it's definitely weird not being with Ross, but I guess I'm doing OK. Actually I've got some of his stuff that he, um....

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Chandler at Monica and Rachel's apartment.]
